direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great, I ran out. Before Ted can stop her, Mary grabs The Load off his ear and WIPES IT IN HER BANGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. UPSCALE NEIGHBORHOOD - NIGHT Healy is still following Tucker in his car. Finally Tucker stops in front of a lavish Victorian home and gets out carrying a pizza and wearing a PIZZA DELIVERY HAT. Healy SCREECHES to a sideways stop, jumps out and POUNCES ON HIM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You motherfucker, you're a dead man! Tucker drops the pizza as Healy SLAMS HIM into a tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cowering) Okay, Pat, take it easy--don't do anything stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the fuck do you think you are making up that bullshit about me?! Healy SLAMS HIM AGAINST THE TREE AGAIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, whoa--I don't know what you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe this'll jog your memory. Healy SLAPS him across the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you a hint--it's got something to do with me being a murderer. Healy raises his arm again and Tucker tries to shield himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay, I might've gotten some bad information. Healy grabs him by the collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That stalker Ted got to you, right? You're working for him, aren't you, you little shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? Healy throws Tucker to the ground and takes off his sport coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your last chance, you fuck. Now either you come clean or I'm going to kick your ass from here to Tallahassee. Healy grabs Tucker by the hair and cocks his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?! Tucker suddenly gets emotional. Healy stops and looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me, goddamnit. I...I love her. Healy slowly lets go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a phony--just like you, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean I'm a fucking fraud. I'm no architect. Don't be a putz--who's been to Santiago twice in a year? (scoffing) Estadio Olimpico --please!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...but you knew people at Harvard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew shit. The only thing I knew was that you were a fake and I made up everything else. (sighs) My real name's Norm. I deliver pizzas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit! Tucker rolls his eyes and pulls out his PIZZA DELIVERY BADGE, with him pictured beside the name Norman Plante. As Healy let's this sink in, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. BAR - NIGHT Ted's rolling a little wine around in a glass. He takes a sip, nods his approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, that's great. The WAITER turns to Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madame? ANGLE ON MARY - The light, puffy bangs that Mary started the night with are gone, replaced by a glazed, ACE VENTURA-STYLE WAVE up front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. The waiter pours her a glass and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now by killer , you mean...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean he murdered someone and did time back in Boston. The guy's a freak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stunned) Jeez, Mary...I'm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, lucky for me I found out. Thank God I have friends like Tucker. (beat) Look, I'm sick of talking about stalkers. (big smile) Let's talk about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ANOTHER BAR - NIGHT Healy and Tucker are bonding over a beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...So then in '94 I went back to Dade Community College for a semester and when the Wal-Mart cashier job fell through I hooked up with the Pizza Barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you met Mary how?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just dumb luck. I delivered a pie to her one night and she answered the door in her nightgown--that was it for me. I went home that night, shaved my beard, and a week later I was laid out in her office with a broken back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you manage that one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (matter-of-factly) Friend. Baseball bat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah, the plan was going along just fine until you showed up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey, hey, I'm not the one who started telling bald-faced lies about the competition--that's crossing the line!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What line? The day you first laid your oily rap on my future wife you started a war!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nothing more than a glorified brother in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you son of a-- Tucker grabs Healy by the jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, calm down, calm down--the bottom line is neither of us are going to get her if we don't do something about that headcase she's with now. As Tucker slowly releases him, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. DRIVING RANGE - NIGHT Ted and Mary are eating CORNDOGS at the snack bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hit the ball pretty good for a fourteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugging) No short game. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should play some time...I mean, if you can afford to lose some money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) What are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit, a twenty-two doesn't carry a one-iron--don't sandbag me, lady. Mary smiles coyly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, sometimes I'm a nineteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's more like it. (to Counter-Man) Two more nitrate-sicles please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got it. Mary is amused by this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nitrate-sicles--I like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say they should put more meats on a stick, you know? They got a lot of sweets on sticks--popsicles, fudgesicles, lollipops--but hardly any meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree there should be more. The Counter-Man hands each of them another corndog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I'd like to see? Meat in a cone. You could put corned beef hash in a cone, or chopped liver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it. And think of the toppings--cheese, mushrooms, mint jelly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to mention ketchup and hot peppers. They smile at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too bad you don't live down here, Ted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pleased) Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got a lot in common. Ted takes a chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...why don't you move back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, my roots here are too deep. I love my practice, the people I work with, Warren's got a nice thing going (joking) Why don't you just move down here and marry me? Mary smiles and Ted LAUGHS...perhaps a little too hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MARY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Ted and Mary are sitting on her front stoop SMOKING A BONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you're a writer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well good for you. I bet it works out for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll see. If it doesn't, what the hell, at least I gave it a shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. And the good thing is you can do it anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you, Mare? How the hell'd you manage to stay single?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...My friends think I'm too picky. I think I'm just a weirdo magnet. I did come close once--just last year, in fact. There was this guy he lived in San Francisco. ANGLE ON the corner of building. We see Healy and Tucker SPYING ON THEM from the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That stalkin' son-of-a-bitch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fucking sickening. Healy and Tucker duck back into the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MARY'S ALLEY - NIGHT Healy is throwing DOGGIE TREATS through an open THIRD-FLOOR WINDOW. INT. MARY'S APARTMENT - SAME We hear the TELEVISION and see Magda DOZING on the couch with a watery COCKTAIL IN HER HAND and the dog Puffy at her feet. Suddenly a DOGGIE TREAT flies through the window, landing on the rug. Puffy SNAPS TO ATTENTION and approaches the treat. He sniffs it, then GOBBLES IT UP. ANOTHER doggie treat lands beside him and he eats that, too. Then ANOTHER. EXT. MARY'S ALLEY - SAME Tucker keeps throwing the treats up and Healy looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That seems like a lot of speed for a little pooch--you sure it won't kill him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never said that. As Tucker throws another... INT. MARY'S APARTMENT - SAME The doggie treat LANDS IN MAGDA'S COCKTAIL, waking her up. Magda looks around, gets her bearings, and then DOWNS THE DRINK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MARY'S APARTMENT BUILDING - SAME Mary and Ted, still sitting on the stoop. Mary seems a little reflective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and then it was all over. (SIGHS) We haven't spoken since.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sincere) Wow. That's too bad. He sounds almost perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...almost. (beat) You want to come up and watch Sportscenter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh no. I think I'm gonna get out while I'm ahead. Mary looks a little disappointed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ted...you're not that far ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Mary, the truth is...I'll be in town for a while now but I don't think we should see each other for a few weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (alarmed) Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...to be honest....I'm really crazy about you and it's making me nervous and when I get nervous I'm not myself and I'm afraid I'm going to doing something really dumb before we get started so I think I should just lay back until I regain my composure. Mary sort of smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's really sweet, Ted, but you should save it for one of your books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, let's go. Ted jumps up and starts up the stairs two at a time. INT. MARY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT As Ted and Mary ENTER, we see Magda HOLDING UP THE COUCH with one hand and VACUUMING WITH THE OTHER. Mary doesn't know what to make of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Magda, what are you doing? Magda turns off the vacuum and we hear a BANGING SOUND coupled with the O.S. MUFFLED YAPPING of Puffy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hi hon. Just straightening up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Puffy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, he was being a pest so I put him in the bathroom. As the O.S. YAPPING AND BANGING continues, Magda PICKS UP THE TELEVISION and starts DUSTING the TV stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Ted, concerned) Um, Ted, I need a moment with Magda--would you let the dog out of the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, sure. Ted walks down the hall, following the YAPPING AND BANGING SOUND until he comes to the bathroom door. The YAPPING is MUCH LOUDER now and he NOTICES SOMETHING THAT MAKES HIM HESITATE. TED'S POV - the bottom part of the door is being DENTED OUTWARD from the force of something BATTERING IT FROM WITHIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CALLING out) Uh, Mare, what kind of dog is Puffy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CALLING out) Toy poodle! Ted thinks about this, shrugs, and opens the door. BARING HIS TEETH like a Rottweiler, Puffy SPRINGS at Ted's jugular! INT. MARY'S LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Ted stumbles back into the living room with the hopped-up dog ON HIS FACE. He KNOCKS OVER A LAMP, tumbles onto the floor, and fights for his life. Mary and Magda SCREAM as Ted and Puffy mix it up on the floor. Ted tries to CRAWL TOWARD THE DOOR but Puffy GRABS THE CUFF OF HIS PANTS. DOOR POV of Ted's anguished face as he gets pulled back into the room. Ted manages to GET THE DOG IN A HEADLOCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it, you're hurting him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (out of breath) Tell him...to calm down. Puffy gets a piece of Ted's wrist and Ted SCREAMS and drops him. Both man and toy poodle SPRING TO THEIR FEET. They start CIRCLING ONE ANOTHER. Puffy leaps at Ted and Ted SMACKS HIM into a wall. Unfazed, the dog gets a running start and LEAPS AT TED'S NECK. Ted manages to duck and PUFFY FLIES OUT THE OPEN WINDOW!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT MIAMI STREET - DAY MONTAGE OF TED AND MARY FALLING IN LOVE --Ted and Warren are at the top of a giant WATER SLIDE Warren motions that he has decided this is not for him. Ted shoots him a look that makes Warren feel like a sissy. Convinced it's not too dangerous, Warren decides to go for it and Ted follows. --At the bottom of the slide Ted splashes into the huge pool of water, laughing, having a blast. Then he looks around...no sign of Warren. Concerned, Ted dives underwater and a moment later Resurfaces clutching a GASPING Warren. EXT. MIAMI STREET - DAY --Mary pumps Warren's stomach as he coughs water out of his mouth. Ted looks on sheepishly. EXT. MIAMI STREET - DAY Ted and Warren walk down a city sidewalk. As they pass a shop Warren points to the window excitedly. THEIR POV In the window there is a mannequin dressed in a Super- hero outfit, i.e. a generic superman. Warren then pulls Ted into the store. CUT TO: EXT. MIAMI STREET - DAY Ted comes out followed by a beaming Warren dressed in the Super-Hero outfit. They continue walking again and a few steps later Warren excitedly points to another shop window. THEIR POV In the window is a mannequin dressed in a cowboy outfit, i.e. Lone Ranger (hat, badge, holster, chaps, vest, boots, spurs, etc.) Again, Warren pulls Ted into the store. CUT TO: EXT. MIAMI STREET - DAY Mary is window shopping with a few bags in hand. She turns and reacts amused. HER POV Warren is now dressed in the cowboy outfit and a humiliated Ted follows dressed in the loose fitting Super-hero outfit. EXT. SCENIC PIER - MIAMI - DAY --Ted and Mary are walking arm and arm on a SCENIC PIER where PEOPLE ARE FISHING. Right behind them are Magda and Herb (the Homeless guy) enjoying one another's company. Ted is on top of the world, feeling good, looking good-right up until he gets the HOOK IN HIS MOUTH. Suddenly he gets YANKED OUT OF FRAME. EXT. SCENIC PIER - MIAMI - DAY --Ted is FLOPPING AROUND on the pavement and a FISHERMAN has his FOOT ON HIS FACE as he STRUGGLES TO REMOVE THE HOOK. Mary looks on, concerned. EXT. GROCERY STORE - MIAMI - DAY --Ted and Mary come out of the grocery store each HOLDING A COUPLE BAGS. Ted also is CARRYING PUFFY, IN A BODYCAST. Ted PUTS PUFFY ON THE ROOF, then starts putting the groceries in the back seat. EXT. MARY'S APARTMENT - DAY --Mary pulls her car up in front of her apartment. AS Ted gets out of the passenger's side, he notices that PUFFY IS STILL ON THE ROOF. He quickly GRABS PUFFY before Mary notices. EXT. BATTING CAGE - MIAMI - DAY --Warren is futilely taking swings in a BATTING CAGE while Mary looks on helplessly. Finally Ted goes into the cage, SIGNALS THE GUY TO STOP THE PITCHING MACHINE, and MOVES WARREN A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE PLATE. --A distraught Ted SITS SOMBERLY on a bench. Beside him, Mary comforts Warren whose LEFT EYE IS BLACK AND BLUE AND COMPLETELY CLOSED. DISSOLVE TO: INT. MARY'S APARTMENT - DAY Ted shows up at Mary's apartment door carrying a BOUQUET OF FLOWERS and a BASEBALL. When he KNOCKS, the door opens. INT. MARY'S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Ted peeks around the corner and sees a SOMBER Mary sitting on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chipper) Hey. Mary doesn't look up. Ted ENTERS, revealing his gifts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The flowers are for you and the ball's for Warren. I had a friend of mine Fedex it to me--it's signed by Tony Conigliaro. Mary finally looks up but doesn't smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hire Pat Healy to follow me around? Ted tries to hide his horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lamely) What do you mean? Mary picks up a letter off the coffee table and hands it to him. Ted takes a quick look and then drops it on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not true...right, Ted? Ted CLEARS HIS THROAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, funny story there. You see, uh, it started out as a uh...yeah...it's true. = Mary stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, hold on, Mary--it's not as bad as it sounds. I certainly didn't know--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That you put a murderer on my trail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well yeah, I didn't know much about him. I just thought--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you think, Ted? That you could spy on me and trick me into thinking you were someone I could...really go for? Mary starts to get emotional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary, I swear I wasn't trying to trick you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what the fuck did you do it for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did it because because I'd never stopped thinking about you and if I didn't find you I knew my life would never be good again. Mary looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) Please leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (devastated) Mary, come on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Okay. And so Ted does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MARY'S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY Ted comes out of the building, a broken man. He paces back and forth on the sidewalk, manic with despair. Then he seems to grow angry. He rifles through his pockets until he finds a SLIP OF PAPER. TED'S POV - the paper reads: 'Healy's Miami address--229 Court Street, apt. 43.' INT. APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY Ted walks down a rather dark hallway until he comes to apartment 43. He KNOCKS on the door but no one answers. He tries the handle and THE DOOR OPENS. INT. SULLY'S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Ted ENTERS and immediately reacts to the STENCH. REVERSE ANGLE reveals that the place is a fucking PIG-STY. DOG SHIT is everywhere, FLIES fill the room, a MOUSE scampers across the carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello...? No answer. Suddenly he HEARS SOMEONE out in the hall, so he ducks behind the door. Healy and Tucker ENTER the apartment and stop in their tracks when they see the MESS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ho-ly shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, this is a pretty nice place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sully...! What the fuck happened here?! Again, no answer. Suddenly Ted SLAMS THE DOOR shut and grabs Healy by the collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (alarmed) Hey, hey, hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surprised?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, buddy, don't do anything rash now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Tucker) Who the fuck are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in love with Mary, too. Ted releases Healy and glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fucked me, man? Why would you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (righteous) What do you mean 'why'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Answer the question, shitball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think everybody could use a drink. Tucker goes into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you asked me to follow your girl around, and I did and I started to like her, and then I realized I just couldn't in good conscience do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (amazed) Do what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn her over to a stalker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?! You're calling me a stalker?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right--if you weren't you would've looked for her yourself! Suddenly they hear a SOUND and turn to see Bill the Boa slithering into the room with A HUGE, GREAT-DANE-SIZE LUMP in his midsection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sickened) Oh Christ...poor dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a sick man, you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah well fuck you! You just can't stand the fact that it was my turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your turn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (getting emotional) That's right, hot shot! My turn . What's the matter with me, huh? Why can't I ever get the great girl? Give the big pig with the B.O. to Healy, right? Well I was sick of it, man! No more--it was my turn. It was time for me...time for me...to be happy. This is so pathetic that it actually gets to Ted. He sits down, runs his fingers through his hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you didn't have to blow us both out of the water. Jesus Christ, just because she found out about you, why'd you have to take me down with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking about the letter, asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Ted stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you telling me you didn't send Mary a letter outlining our deal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the fuck would I do that? I'd be screwing myself. The guys stare at one another, then Tucker comes out the kitchen with a drink. They turn their attention to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You little fuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fucking prick, we had a deal--you said you wouldn't fuck me and I wouldn't fuck you until we had this fuck out of the fucking picture. (moves in on Tucker) You crossed the line, man. Tucker backs away nervously. TUCKER Whoa, whoa, you're getting crazy now. Why would I cross the line--what do you think I got no pride? Healy grabs Tucker by the neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear! I didn't tell her nothing! You probably did it yourself, you piece of shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh that makes a lot of sense. Why would I rat myself out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like I'm going to try to figure out a guy who's idea of courting is blowing farts in the chick's face
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were following us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't flatter yourself--I was following her , I always do. How the hell you think I got rid of Mary's boyfriend Steve? This gets Ted's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean...Steve didn't say all that stuff about Warren?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you shitting me--Mr. Goody-Two-Shoes? He was like a fucking eagle scout. You two should be kissing my balls--if it wasn't for me, she might've married that schmuck! Ted thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hell with you both--I'm out of here. Ted walks out the door leaving Healy and Tucker to stare each other down. Just then Hal the Great Dane walks out of the bedroom with a CEREAL BOX stuck on his head. Healy does a double-take, then looks back at the snake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sadly) Oh...Sully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, if it wasn't you who sent the letter, and it wasn't me who sent it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MARY'S APARTMENT - DAY CLOSE ON an alarmed Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woogie? What are what are you doing here? REVERSE ANGLE reveals Dom sitting on her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you get my letter, Mare? The one about Ted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sent that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. I was worried about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...thank you. But...you know you're not supposed to be within four hundred yards of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (excited) That's what I want to tell ya. I've been through two years of extensive psychotherapy and you know what? You were right --I needed help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cautious) That's great, Woogie, I'm happy you're better--you seem...good--but...you put me through quite an ordeal, you know. Dom nods aggressively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to move, go to court, change my last name--you stole all my shoes! Dom stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me. Mary turns her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God above, on everything that is holy to me, I did not steal your shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woogie, I caught you red-handed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I did, but I was in a weird place then. He approaches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a break, Mare, I was nuts! Mary backs into the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HEALY'S CAR - DAY Healy and Tucker are parked right out front LISTENING TO THIS CONVERSATION. They seem concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woogie, please, you're starting to scare me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell's Woogie? Tucker just shrugs. BACK ON Mary and Dom. =~
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm asking you to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gentle) Oh, Mary, honey, you're taking this all wrong. (beat) I'm not leaving... BACK IN HEALY'S CAR DOM (cont'd) (V.O.) ...Not until I get a little something to remember you by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (clearly struggling) Stop that! No! Somebody help me!!!!! Healy and Tucker jump out of the car and RUN INTO THE BUILDING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MARY'S APARTMENT - DAY Healy and Tucker STORM INTO THE ROOM and freeze at what they see. THEIR POV - Dom is cradling SEVERAL PAIRS OF SHOES in his arms and trying to crawl to the door while Mary holds him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just one pair! You owe me that much, you heartless bitch! Healy and Tucker grab Dom and throw him down on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dom, you're pathetic, fucking over your friend Ted like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You fucked him over, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's no friend of mine. Suddenly Magda ENTERS from her bedroom. She's holding a half-eaten BANANA SPLIT. Herb, the Homeless Man, follows after her, sporting a Tom Jones and buttoning up his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on here? At first no one knows what to say. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in love with your roommate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, Christ, I can't take it anymore. I'm gonna pack my bags and go back to my own place. Magda heads back into her bedroom and Herb follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tucker, where are your crutches? Tucker is stumped for a second, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (British accent) Interesting query, Mary... Healy slaps Tucker in the back of the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut the fuck up and tell her the truth. Before he can respond, Ted ENTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well isn't this nice--now we've got the whole gang together. Ted can hardly believe Dom is there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dom? What are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stole her from me. Now I want her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rolling eyes) Woogie and I went out for awhile in high school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stunned) You're Woogie ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dom Wooganowski. Duh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But but you're married. You have kids a great wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're so happy with them, please, be my guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I may I have a proposal. Everyone turns to Healy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say none of us leave this room until our young Mary here stops jerking us around and decides once and for all who she wants. Now Mary, I know this is difficult but you really will be doing them all a favor to tell them the truth about us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? Why would I pick you? You're a murderer. Healy glares at Tucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, well...not exactly. You see, I exaggerated a little there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean he's not a criminal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God no! (pleased) I'm just a pathological liar! Mary looks at Tucker, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tucker...not you, too? Tucker lowers his head and reluctantly nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name's Norm. I live up in Pompano with my folks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Jesus... Just then the door opens and BRETT FAVRE, the Packers quarterback ENTERS, with Warren (wearing a walkman) beside him. Everyone is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brett...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is Brett Favre doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in town to play the Dolphins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called him. I told him to pick up Warren and get over here. everyone turns their attention to Ted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary, I found out that your buddy Tucker there lied to you about Brett. Tucker lowers his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brett never said anything bad about Warren. He loves Warren...and from what he just told me on the phone, he loves you, too. (beat) He's the guy you should be with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, Mare. And you know I'll always be true to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw shit, this isn't fair. Mary manages a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Mary) I realized something tonight. I'm no better than any of these guys. None of them really love you...they just fixated on you because of how you made them feel. But that's not real love...Thank you for letting me see that. Now I can get on with the rest of my life. Tucker, Healy, and Dom scoff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't listen to him, Mary. It's a ploy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are so full of shit, Strohman. Are you going to stand here and tell us that you aren't in love with this girl? Ted looks into Mary's eyes. She looks vulnerable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...that's what I'm telling you. (winks) See you, Mare. Ted looks Mary in the eye, then starts for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as he passes Warren) See you, Warren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh...? Ted lifts the earphones off Warren's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you, Warren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye, Ted. Ted then WALKS OUT OF THE ROOM. They all stand there in silence for a moment, then Dom turns to Brett Favre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Brett, any chance I can get you to autograph one of these pumps for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MIAMI STREET - DAY Ted is walking down the street BLUBBERING LIKE A SCHOOLGIRL. Everyone he passes stares at him. Suddenly Mary comes running down the OTHER SIDE OF THE STREET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ted! Ted stops and looks across the street at her. He wipes his eyes, hopeful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What what are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You forgot your keys! She holds up a RABBIT FOOT KEY-CHAIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (deflated) Oh. Thanks. They remain across the street from one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you mean what you said back there, Ted? Ted starts to well up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ted...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking down) I...I just want you to be happy, Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I think I'd be happiest...with you. Ted just stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fucking with me, right? Mary smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wiping eyes) But but what about Steve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah, that'd make golf real fun--the guy doesn't even drink beer or gamble. Now Ted smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get over here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. The BEAMING Ted starts walking across the street. Suddenly a BUS WHIZZES BY AND SMACKS TED BROADSIDE. He bounces around under the bus like a rag doll, then finally squirts out the back end and TUMBLES TO A LIMP STOP. Mary SCREAMS and runs toward the body as a CROWD begins to gather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ted, no, no....! She starts giving him CPR. Somebody covers him with a blanket. Just then, another CAR WHIZZES OVER HIS FEET like speedbumps. The crowd winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody hold up traffic! (beat) Come on, Ted. Come on. Tell me you're going to be okay. Then Ted takes a deep breath and his eyes flutter open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary....Oh Mary, I love you. Mary's smile is as bright as the light from heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you too, Ted. (beat) I think I always have. As the two lovebirds kiss, a LADY CALLS OUT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over here! I found his foot! It was in the storm drain! ON THE LADY as she holds up a SEVERED FOOT in a cloth.
